title.title: Letter from R. S. Pryor to Mississippi Governer John J. Pettus; November 25, 1861

note.p: Located in Warren County, Mississippi, Vicksburg was founded under the name Fort Nogales as early as 1790 in what was then unincorporated territory. In 1798, upon creation of Mississippi Territory, it was renamed Walnut Hills. On April 1, 1799, Walnut Hills became part of the newly created Pickering County (later renamed Jefferson County on January 10, 1802), until the creation of Claiborne County on January 26, 1802. It then became part of its current county of Warren on December 21, 1809. Upon its incorporation on January 29th, 1825, it was renamed Vicksburg. Vicksburg became the county seat in 1836 and remains today. (Rowland, Mississippi, 858; Wikipedia; Britannica; Atlas of Historical County Boundaries)
The Colony of Virginia was established in May 1607. Admitted as the 10th state, Virginia achieved statehood June 25, 1788. (Britannica)

element.label: Description
element.value: From the Mississippi Department of Archives and History Governor Pettus Collection. Letter from Vicksburg, Mississippi, by R. S. Pryor, seeking the position of agent to oversee goods being sent to Mississippi troops in Virginia.

div.p: I presume you are the proper person to make my applycation for—this business so I will make so to you. I wish to know from your Excelency wether or not any more Agents are wanted to run from here to Va to see to the freight of our Brave Soldiers. Isee from the papers that a large quantity of goods shiped to them are from some Cause lost. If you desire to have a good agent and who takes an interest in the welfare of our Soldiers and the freedom of our Infant Country who is now gasping for freedom I will offer you my humble services. Ihave been raised here and long since would have shouldered my gun for my native South if Circumstances over which I have no controll had not forbid
tendering services to go to Va with clothing

though I am representated in the shape of a nephew in our great army still I would like to be their myself to do what my feeble [torn page] arm might do. Mr O Hammett from here is in that capacity but thought their might be work for another. If one is wanted & should be that one selected Iwill do every thing that can be done to see that our Soldiers have their rights.
I will be pleased to hear from your Excelency on the subject Iwill say that I can be ready on very short notice. I am Very Respect
